llm_results: [{"detection_name": "LLM: field_suggestions", "detection": "potential", "category": "Unknown", "description": "The GraphQL error responses include \"Did you mean ...\" suggestions that reveal valid field names on types (e.g., title, completed, username, name, email). This is a field_suggestions information-disclosure issue: by returning likely field names, the server aids attackers in schema discovery and reconnaissance, which may facilitate further attacks (enumeration of sensitive fields or crafting targeted queries). The response is a validation error (400) but still exposes schema details. Recommend disabling suggestion text in production or returning generic validation errors, and limiting error verbosity to authenticated/authorized callers.", "evidence": "Error messages: \"Cannot query field \\\"titlle\\\" on type \\\"Todo\\\".
